attributes.action: use legislation to force manufacturers, suppliers and producers to be more responsible in how they package products, rather than taxing household waste disposal under the "pay as you throw"  scheme.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Pay as you throw schemes for waste disposal are the latest buzz word. Recently, politicians have taken the line that "pay as you throw" is common practice in other European countries, so it is acceptable to introduce it here, without tackling the route cause of the problem. Whilst householders should be encouraged to recycle a higher proportion of their waste, more should be done to reduce the amount of packaging that is produced in the first place. Have you ever bought a child a Barbie doll or any other toy from a high street toy shop?
Far too much fresh food comes packaged, supermarkets should be targetted with reducing the amount of packaging that is on products. 
Introducing Pay as you throw will encourage flytipping, which will ultimately cost UK taxpayers more, as Councils are forced to clean up.
